segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the type of enterprise accounting information which is transmitted and provide its identification number.
DTM, A segment containing the opening and closing dates of the accounting period and the preparation date of the message.
RFF, A segment containing the number of the information file linked to the message and its version number.
CUX, A segment providing currencies which are specific to the enterprise accounting information message.

FTX, A segment with free text, in coded or clear form, for the purpose of providing additional clarification solely concerning the summary section. In computer-to-computer exchanges such texts will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group giving information on sender, recipient and intermediary.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party.
RFF, A segment to provide references which are specific to the concerned party.
FII, A segment identifying the bank account of the related party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify contacts and related communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide contacts related to the party.
COM, A segment to provide communication numbers of the contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social or legal characteristics of the enterprise accounting information message.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: SG5-SG7 A segment group providing the expected information related to the enterprise. The index value contained in the index segment determines how informations in the subordinate segments in the same group, should be interpreted.

segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment providing the sequential number of the provided information in the message.
IND, A segment to identify a relevant index.
RFF, A segment to provide reference related to information specified in the index segment.
MOA, A segment to provide amount related to information specified in the index segment.
FTX, A segment to provide text related to information specified in the index segment.
DTM, A segment providing a date or time or period related to information specified in the index segment.
QTY, A segment providing a quantity related to information specified in the index segment.
CUX, A segment to provide currency related to information specified in the index segment.
PCD, A segment to provide a percentage related to information specified in the index segment.
FII, A segment identifying the bank account for payment.
CPT, A segment to provide account related to information specified in the index segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A segment group to identify a party related to information specified in the index segment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify contacts and provide communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment providing contact information related to the party identified in the preceding segment.
COM, A segment providing communication information related to the party or the contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social, legal characteristics of the enterprise related to information specified in the index segment.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to provide authentication information.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to provide authentication results.
DTM, A segment to provide the date of the authentication.
